patch.description:
This endpoint associates the device to the patient provided in the request body.

In order to associate a device with a patient, all of the following must apply:
- The Patient must be associated with the Customer making the request
- The Device must be owned by the Customer making the request
- The Device must be associated with a non-Impilo site
- The Device must have a current status of "availableAtSite"
***
For more information see the [AssociateDeviceRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_AssociateDeviceRequest).

This endpoint disables readings for the device provided in the request body. Readings received while
in this status will not be processed or saved. No alerts or webhooks will be triggered for these readings.

In order to disable readings for a device, all of the following must apply:
- The Device must be owned by the Customer making the request
- The Device's "disabledReadings" field must be false
***
For more information see the [DeviceReferenceRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_DeviceReferenceRequest).

This endpoint disassociates the device from the patient provided in the Request body.

In order to disassociate a device from a patient, all of the following must apply:
- The Patient must be associated with the Customer making the request
- The Device must be owned by the Customer making the request
- The Device must already be associated with the provided Patient
- The Device must be associated with a non-Impilo site
- The Device must have a current status of "withPatient"
***
For more information see the [AssociateDeviceRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_AssociateDeviceRequest).

This endpoint re-enables readings for the device provided in the request body.

In order to re-enable readings for a device, all of the following must apply:
- The Device must be owned by the Customer making the request
- The Device's "disabledReadings" field must be true
***
For more information see the [DeviceReferenceRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_DeviceReferenceRequest).

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new Item in the Impilo platform. This endpoint is only enabled for Customers that are also Manufacturer accounts.

Items created via this endpoint will:
- receive a generated SKU and ID
- have a Manufacturer set to the requesting Customer
- be set to an Orderable status of FALSE

Items created with this endpoint are not able to be ordered until approved manually by an Impilo Admin.
Items can still be procured and received within Impilo's system while the orderable parameter is false.
***
For more information see the [ItemRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_ItemRequest).

post.description:
Creates a Transfer Request, which consists of Items and Quantities to transfer from a
Customer account to one of it's sub-Customer accounts.

To submit a transfer request, the Target Customer must be a sub-Customer account of the
requestor and the body must consist of at least one TransferItem object with a quantity
greater than 0.

You can only request up to 500 items be transferred at a time. If you need to transfer more,
multiple Transfer Request submissions are required.

The only requirement for the TransferItem's item parameter is a JSON object that includes
an ID of the Item requested.
***
For more information see the [ItemTransferRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_ItemTransferRequest).

This endpoint returns a paginated list of Blood Glucose Readings for the patients associated with a Customer.

Filtering can be done by any of the following query parameters:
- page (integer) -- The page number of the content returned.
- size (integer) -- The size of the page of content returned.
- patientId (long) -- The patient's Impilo identifier.
- externalId (string) -- Any external identifier associated with this patient.
- startTimestamp (string) -- An ISO-formatted string with an applicable timezone, such as 2024-01-25T13:50:50.0Z
- endTimestamp (string) -- An ISO-formatted string with an applicable timezone, such as 2024-01-27T13:50:50.0Z

post.description:
Records a blood glucose reading based on the provided request. Either a device ID, device identifier, or patient ID is required.
***
For more information see the [BloodGlucoseReadingRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_BloodGlucoseReadingRequest).

get.description: Exports blood glucose readings for a specified patient within a given date range as either an Excel spreadsheet or a CSV file. This endpoint allows clients to specify a patient ID, and optional start and end dates to filter the readings by date. If no patient ID is provided, readings for all patients may be exported depending on the implementation. The 'excel' parameter determines the format of the export: if true, the data is returned in Excel format; otherwise, it is returned as CSV. The response is directly streamed to the client as either 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet' for Excel or 'text/csv' for CSV format.

parameters.name: excel
parameters.description: Determines the format of the export: if true, the data is returned in Excel format; otherwise, it is returned as CSV.

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The ID of the patient whose blood glucose readings are to be exported. If not provided, readings for all patients may be exported.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date for filtering blood glucose readings. Only readings after or equal to this date will be included.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date for filtering blood glucose readings. Only readings before this date will be included.

The 'excel' parameter controls the output format: if set to true, the data is delivered in Excel format; if false, it is delivered in CSV format. The data is streamed directly to the client and can be consumed in the specified format.

get.description: Facilitates the export of temperature readings for a specified patient within a chosen date range, in either Excel or CSV format. This endpoint allows the selection of a patient ID for targeted data retrieval, or can provide readings for all patients if no specific ID is provided, subject to service implementation. The start and end dates are optional and can be used to filter the readings to a specific period. The 'excel' parameter decides the output format: setting this to true returns the data in Excel format, while false yields CSV format. The endpoint streams the output directly to the client in the specified format.

parameters.name: excel
parameters.description: Determines the format of the export: if true, the data is returned in Excel format; otherwise, it is returned as CSV.

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The ID of the patient whose temperature readings are to be exported. If not provided, readings for all patients may be exported.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date for filtering temperature readings. Only readings after or equal to this date will be included.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date for filtering temperature readings. Only readings before this date will be included.

get.description: Fetches a specific Impilo temperature reading by its ID.

Retrieves a paginated list of weight readings from the Impilo platform. Optional parameters can be used to filter the results by page number, page size, patient ID, external ID, start timestamp, and end timestamp.

post.description:
This endpoint records a weight reading based on the provided request. Either a device ID, device identifier, or patient ID is required.
***
For more information see the [WeightReadingRequest Model](/resources/models#schema_WeightReadingRequest).

get.description: Exports weight readings for a specified patient over a selected date range, available in either Excel or CSV format. This endpoint allows the specification of a patient ID, enabling the retrieval of weight data for an individual patient. Alternatively, if no patient ID is provided, it may export readings for all patients, dependent on the implementation details of the service. Users can also specify start and end dates to filter the export to a specific timeframe. The 'excel' parameter dictates the format of the output; if set to true, the readings are exported in Excel format, otherwise in CSV format

parameters.name: excel
parameters.description: Determines the format of the export: if true, the data is returned in Excel format; otherwise, it is returned as CSV.

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The ID of the patient whose weight readings are to be exported. If not provided, readings for all patients may be exported.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date for filtering weight readings. Only readings after or equal to this date will be included.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date for filtering weight readings. Only readings before this date will be included.

get.description: Fetches a specific Impilo weight reading by its ID.

rules.description:
List of rules that determine when blood pressure alerts are triggered.
Each rule can be either:

Threshold Rule:
\{
  "type": "threshold",
  "field": "systolic|diastolic",
  "operator": "gt|lt",
  "value": 140,
  "severity": "NONE|LOW|MEDIUM|HIGH"
\}

Relative Change Rule:
\{
  "type": "relative_change",
  "field": "systolic|diastolic",
  "direction": "increase|decrease",
  "value": 20.0,     // percentage: 0-100
  "severity": "NONE|LOW|MEDIUM|HIGH"
\}

Item.description: An item is any of the supplies handled by Impilo. Examples include medical devices like a blood pressure monitor or weight scale, but the term 'item' also refers to non-medical supplies like AAA batteries and package inserts. A customer catalog is a subset of all items supported by Impilo. This is set during onboarding and may be modified by your account manager at any time. A customer may view the items in their catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier for the item, managed by Impilo.

cpap.description: Items related to Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP).

respiratory.description: Items related to the respiratory system.

ItemDetailed.description: An item is any of the supplies handled by Impilo. Examples include medical devices like a blood pressure monitor or weight scale, but the term 'item' also refers to non-medical supplies like AAA batteries and package inserts. A customer catalog is a subset of all items supported by Impilo. This is set during onboarding and may be modified by your account manager at any time. A customer may view the items in their catalog. Detailed Item views are only seen in the Item list and fetch endpoints -- otherwise, a lighter version of an Item is returned with other non-Item endpoints.

Page.description: Pagination is supported whenever an API response returns a list of objects. In paginated responses, objects are nested in a content attribute and have first and last attributes indicating whether you are on the first or last page, respectively. Additionally, the pagination response includes a page attribute indicating the current page number, a size attribute indicating the current page size, and a total attribute indicating the number of objects matching the request.

content.description: The content of the page, consisting of a list of objects.

page.description: The current page number. The first page has value 1.

size.description: The current page size. Default 15, maximum 250.

total.description: The number of objects matching the request.

first.description: True if this is the first page, false otherwise.

last.description: True if this is the last page, false otherwise.

PageManufacturer.description: Pagination is supported whenever an API response returns a list of objects. In paginated responses, objects are nested in a content attribute and have first and last attributes indicating whether you are on the first or last page, respectively. Additionally, the pagination response includes a page attribute indicating the current page number, a size attribute indicating the current page size, and a total attribute indicating the number of objects matching the request.

content.description: The content of the page, consisting of a list of objects.

page.description: The current page number. The first page has value 1.

size.description: The current page size. Default 15, maximum 250.

total.description: The number of objects matching the request.

first.description: True if this is the first page, false otherwise.

last.description: True if this is the last page, false otherwise.

id.description: Unique identifier for the patient, managed by Impilo.

externalIdentifier.description: Unique external identifier for the patient, managed by the customer.

dateOfBirth.description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

archived.description: True if the patient is archived, false otherwise.

address.description: The patient's shipping address. Required on all endpoints except PATCH patient.

site.description: The site responsible for this patient.

enrolled.description: The enrollment status. False if disenrolled.

lpm.description: Peak expiratory flow unit of measurement is liters per minute.

PeakFlowReading.description: This page describes Impilo's peak flow reading model.

id.description: Unique identifier for the reading.

manual.description: True if the reading value was entered manually, false or null otherwise.

deviceTimeZoneOffset.description: The offset of the device's timezone from UTC in seconds. Null if unavailable.

patientTimeZoneOffset.description: The offset of the patient's timezone from UTC in seconds. Null if unavailable.

PeakFlowReadingRequest.description: This page describes Impilo's peak flow reading request model.

deviceId.description: The id of the device that took the reading.

deviceIdentifier.description: The device identifier of the device that took the reading.

patientId.description: The id of the patient that took the reading.

readingTimestamp.description: The UTC timestamp at which the reading was taken.

deviceTimeZoneOffset.description: The offset of the device's timezone from UTC in seconds. Null if unavailable.

peakExpiratoryFlow.description: The Peak Expiratory Flow, measured in L/min.

forcedExpiratoryVolumeInOneSecond.description: The Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second value, in L.

manual.description: True if the reading value was entered manually, false or null otherwise.

Procurement.description: A procurement is a procurement of devices by a customer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the site, managed by Impilo.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the procurement

procurementItems.description: List of items on the procurement

procurementEvents.description: List of events attached to the procurement

Return.description: A return is an occurrence of a device(s) or non-tracked item(s) being returned by a Patient.

id.description: Unique identifier for the return, managed by Impilo.

patient.description: The patient that is making the return.

site.description: The site that is making the return.

currentStatus.description: The current status of this return.

returnKits.description: An array of kits related to items expected on this return.

returnItems.description: An array of non-tracked items expected on this return.

returnEvents.description: An array of the return events for this return.

trackingNumbers.description: An array of tracking numbers associated with this return.

returnDevices.description: An array of devices expected on this return.

relatedOrderId.description: The identifier of a related order, if exists.

id.description: The id of the device expected on this return.

type.description: The event type for the Return Event.

eventTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the Return Event was created.

item.description: The item type expected on this return.

count.description: The quantity of this item type expected on this return.

receiving.description: Return merchandise authorization is in receiving.

arrived.description: Return merchandise authorization has arrived at Impilo.

pendingReturn.description: Return merchandise authorization is pending return.

outbound.description: Return merchandise authorization is outbound to patient.

rmaPlaced.description: Return merchandise authorization has been placed.

voided.description: Return merchandise authorization has been voided.

inTransit.description: Return merchandise authorization is in transit to Impilo.

other.description: Sex other than male or female.

id.description: The id of the item expected on this return.

Site.description: A site is a customer-managed location that interacts with Impilo's services. Patient may be associated with a site, and a customer may order items and hold inventory at a site.

id.description: Unique identifier for the site, managed by Impilo.

active.description: True if the site is active, false otherwise.

address.description: The shipping address for the site.

deviceId.description: The id of the device that took the reading.

deviceIdentifier.description: The device identifier of the device that took the reading.

patientId.description: The id of the patient that took the reading.

readingTimestamp.description: The UTC timestamp at which the reading was taken.

deviceTimeZoneOffset.description: The offset of the device's timezone from UTC in seconds. Null if unavailable.

respiration.description: Respiratory rate per minute during sleep.

heartRate.description: Average heart rate per minutes during recorded period.

bodyTurnOver.description: Number of times the subject rolled over during the recorded period.

duration.description: Duration of sleep during tracked period.

bedTime.description: List of times sleep started during the period.

manual.description: True if the reading value was entered manually, false or null otherwise.

upTime.description: List of times sleep was disrupted due to subject getting up during the period.

respiration.description: Respiratory rate per minute during sleep.

heartRate.description: Average heart rate per minutes during recorded period.

bodyTurnOver.description: Number of times the subject rolled over during the recorded period.

duration.description: Duration of sleep during tracked period.

rem.description: Number of minutes of detected rem sleep.

deepSleep.description: Number of minutes of detected deep sleep.

lightSleep.description: Number of minutes of detected light sleep.

SupportTicket.description: A Support Ticket is a case that's been opened by either an Impilo team member, a Customer team member, or a Patient.

id.description: The ID of the Support Ticket.

customer.description: The Customer to whom this Support Ticket belongs.

patient.description: The Patient that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable.

order.description: The Order that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable.

device.description: The Device that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable.

site.description: The Site that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable.

supportTicketNotes.description: A list of all SupportTicketNotes attached to this Support Ticket.

supportTicketEvents.description: A list of all SupportTicketEvents attached to this Support Ticket.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the Support Ticket.

open.description: Whether or not the ticket is considered open or closed.

assignedTeam.description: The team that's assigned this Support Ticket, if any.

assignee.description: The EndUser assigned to this Support Ticket, if any.

createdBy.description: The creator of this Support Ticket.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the Support Ticket was created.

lastUpdated.description: The most recent time that this Support Ticket was updated in some form.

email.description: The email address to note as the assignee for the Support Ticket.

SupportTicketEvent.description: A representation of an event occurrence for a Support Ticket.

eventType.description: The type of event that occurred.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the event occurrence.

event.description: The requested event to add to the Support Ticket.

note.description: The note to attach alongside the event.

SupportTicketNote.description: A note that's attached to a given Support Ticket.

createdBy.description: The user that created the note.

note.description: The actual text of the note.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the note was created.

note.description: The note to post to the Support Ticket.

SupportTicketRequest.description: A Support Ticket is a case that's been opened by either an Impilo team member, a Customer team member, or a Patient.

patient.description: The Patient that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable. Only the ID is required.

order.description: The Order that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable. Only the ID is required.

device.description: The Device that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable. Only the ID is required.

site.description: The Site that the Support Ticket involves, if applicable. Only the ID is required.

note.description: A list of all SupportTicketNotes attached to this Support Ticket.

diastolic.description: The diastolic blood pressure measurement value.

TrackingNumber.description: The tracking number model includes details about the shipping carrier and the tracking number value.

carrier.description: The shipping carrier for this tracking number.

item.description: The Item being requested to transfer. Only the ID of the item is required.

count.description: The number of Items being requested for transfer.

devices.description: The actual Devices being transferred. Only populated once the Transfer Request is completed.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TransferRequest.

fromCustomer.description: Customer from which the Inventory will be transferred away from. Typically auto-set to the caller of the TransferRequest endpoints.

toCustomer.description: The target Customer to send the requested Inventory to.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the Transfer Request was first created.

transferRequestNotes.description: Notes attached to this Transfer Request.

transferRequestEvents.description: The sequence of events that this Transfer Request has undergone. Sorted most recent event first.

transferItems.description: The Inventory that's being requested to transfer.

eventTimestamp.description: The timestamp when this event took place.

note.description: The note that is linked to a Transfer Request.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the note was created.

valid.description: A Boolean value of whether this device identifier is validated or not.

device.description: The Device associated with the provided Device Identifier, if exists.

Webhook.description: Impilo supports various types of webhooks. This page describes the endpoints available for managing your webhooks.

type.description: The event type for the webhook.

url.description: The URL where events for this webhook will be sent.

WebhookLog.description: Represents a log for a webhook.

id.description: ID of the webhook log event

createTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the webhook was sent

lastResponseStatus.description: Last response status for the webhook

retryAttempts.description: Number of retry attempts for the webhook

lastRetryTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last retry attempt for the webhook

WebhookPayload.description: Impilo supports various types of webhooks. This page describes the endpoints available for managing your webhooks.

id.description: Unique identifier for the webhook payload, managed by Impilo.

type.description: The event type for the webhook.

secret.description: Secret we will pass along with any Webhooks we send to your subscribed endpoints.

reading.sleepMatDuration.description: A sleep mat duration reading was taken.

procurement.status.description: A procurement status event occurred. The payload only includes procurement id and event type.

reading.weight.description: A body weight reading was taken.

reading.temperature.description: A body temperature reading was taken.

return.status.description: A return status event was triggered.

reading.bloodGlucose.description: A reading of blood glucose was taken.

device.weakSignal.description: A device sent a weak signal.

order.statusFull.description: An order status event occurred. The payload includes the full order model.
